WRITING.TITLE: These are around a month and a half old. The other day, I realized something, and now I #8217;m glad I didn #8217;t go any closer to my wrist. (Continued in comments)

WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m a trans guy, and I hope to one day get bottom surgery (sexual reassignment surgery). To do that, the surgeons need to take a skin graft and vein graft from somewhere on your body, and the forearm is the ideal place in my opinion. My other arm is definitely out of the question, so this one is my best bet. If I would #8217;ve cut any closer to my wrist, I probably would #8217;ve ruined any chance at being able to take a graft from there. I was also planning on getting a tattoo on that wrist when I went out of state with my family, but luckily, the state we went to had the minimum age to get a tattoo set at 18 even with parental consent. Hopefully, there #8217;s still enough unscarred skin for a graft, but I still have years and years and years until I can get the surgery anyway. I would #8217;ve been so pissed at myself if I would #8217;ve scarred up my wrist. I got lucky this time, I guess.
